class cookiecutter.operators.checkbox.InquirerCheckboxOperator(*args, **kwargs)[source]Â¶

Bases: cookiecutter.operators.BaseOperator

Operator for PyInquirer type prompts.

Takes in three forms of choices inputs. 1. list of string 2. list of maps with all keys = name 3. list of maps with the key as the output, the value as displayed question

Parameters

  • message â€“ String message to show when prompting.

  • choices â€“ A list of strings or list of k/v pairs per above description

  • name â€“ A key to insert the output value to. If not provided defaults to inserting into parent key

  • qmark â€“ A marker to select with like ðŸ˜ƒ

Returns

List of answers

cookiecutter.operators.nukikata moduleÂ¶

Operator plugin that inherits a base class and is made available through type.

class cookiecutter.operators.nukikata.NukikataOperator(*args, **kwargs)[source]Â¶

Bases: cookiecutter.operators.BaseOperator

Operator for calling external cookiecutters.

Parameters

  • template â€“ A directory containing a project template, or a URL to a git repository.

  • templates â€“ A list of directories containing a project template, or a URL to a git repository.

  • checkout â€“ The branch, tag or commit ID to checkout after clone.

  • no_input â€“ Prompt the user at command line for manual configuration?

  • extra_context â€“ A dictionary of context that overrides default and user configuration.

  • replay â€“ Do not prompt for input, instead read from saved json. If True read from the replay_dir. if it exists

  • output_dir â€“ Where to output the generated project dir into.

  • config_file â€“ User configuration file path.

  • default_config â€“ Use default values rather than a config file.

  • password â€“ The password to use when extracting the repository.

  • directory â€“ Relative path to a cookiecutter template in a repository.

  • accept_hooks â€“ Accept pre and post hooks if set to True.

Returns

Dictionary of output

type = 'nukikata'Â¶

Bases: cookiecutter.operators.BaseOperator

Operator that reads an input hcl file and prompts user to fill in.

Typically this is used with a variables.tf file.

Parameters

  • variables_file â€“ A path to a file to read

  • var_list â€“ A list of items to only parse and prompt

  • var_skip_list â€“ A list of items to skip when prompting

Returns

Dictionary that can be dumped into json for a terraform.tfvars.json

class cookiecutter.operators.yaml.YamlOperator(*args, **kwargs)[source]Â¶

Bases: cookiecutter.operators.BaseOperator

Operator for yaml.

Parameters

  • path â€“ The file path to put read or write to

  • contents â€“ Supplied dictionary or list to write.

  • remove â€“ Parameter or regex to remove from list or dict

  • update â€“ Use the python update dict method on contents before writing

  • merge_config â€“ Recursively update the contents before writing.

  • mode â€“ The mode that the file should write. Defaults to write â€˜wâ€™. Seee https://docs.python.org/3/library/functions.html#open

Operator plugin base class that all __subclassess__ are brought in scope.
